hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Reversal Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: When Bitcoin experiences consecutive days of ETF net outflows (>$200M cumulative over 3 days) during a NEUTRAL/BULL regime, the subsequent first day of net inflows (>$100M) will trigger a disproportionate price rally of 1.8-2.5x the inflow amount's expected impact, as short-term bears are forced to cover.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sustained ETF outflows create bearish sentiment and short positioning. When flows reverse, it signals institutional re-accumulation, forcing shorts to cover. The amplification comes from both the actual buying pressure AND the short squeeze component. Current market shows this dynamic with recent $600M liquidations hiding larger macro catalysts.
entry_conditions: BTC in NEUTRAL or BULL regime (confidence > 55%)
3+ consecutive days of net ETF outflows totaling >$200M
First day of net inflows >$100M occurs
BTC price holds above the low of the outflow period
Funding rates turn negative during outflow period (perpetual swaps)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3.2% move from entry OR 1.5x the 5-day average true range, whichever is larger
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Break below the low of the outflow period

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to rally on inflow resumption OR rallies less than 1.2x the expected impact (based on historical $ inflow to % price change ratio) in >40% of cases.
